publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-2849 Bill Kidd: Treating Lone Parents as Unemployed - Planned Changes to Benefits—That the Parliament expresses concern at the UK Government’s plans to require lone parents, from 24 November 2008 for those with a youngest child of 12 years old, from 26 October 2009 for those with a youngest child of 10 years old and from 25 October 2010 for those with a youngest child of seven years old, to be available for work, claim jobseekers allowance and be subject to consequential benefit sanctions and considers that these measures seriously undervalue the unpaid work of raising children, treating the raising of children as the equivalent of being unemployed. Motions and amendments which have attracted additional support

S3M-2849 Treating Lone Parents as Unemployed - Planned Changes to Benefits (lodged on 10 November 2008) Joe FitzPatrick*, Rob Gibson*, Alasdair Allan*, Bashir Ahmad*, Bill Wilson*, Alex Neil*, Jamie Hepburn*
S3M-2849 Treating Lone Parents as Unemployed - Planned Changes to Benefits (lodged on 10 November 2008) Gil Paterson*, Christina McKelvie*, Stuart McMillan*
